subtasks.notes: Open the Find and Replace dialog
subtasks.name: Cmd + F

subtasks.notes: Show/Hide Terminal (& Switch the cursor between Terminal and code)
subtasks.name: Ctrl + ` = Cmd+ J

subtasks.notes: Toggle Zen mode (View > Appearance > Zen Mode/Centered Layout)
subtasks.name: Cmd + K Z

subtasks.notes:
Multi-cursor editing - it selects all matches in the current file to the currently highlighted text. Press "ESC" to disable it.
—
Bonus: Install the “[Multiple Cursor Case Preserve](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=Cardinal90.multi-cursor-case-preserve)” extension for Visual Studio Code. It ensures that when you’re editing text with multiple cursors, the case formatting—such as camelCase, UPPERCASE, or lowercase—is preserved. This is particularly useful when you need to rename variables or terms consistently without disrupting their original casing.
subtasks.name: Cmd + Shift + L

subtasks.notes: Open the Explorer file tree and reveal the file you’re currently viewing.
subtasks.name: Cmd + Shift + E

subtasks.notes: Open Problems panel (for linting errors, warnings, and diagnostics)
subtasks.name: Cmd + Shift + M

subtasks.notes: Rename every occurrence of the same reference
subtasks.name: F2

subtasks.notes: Put cursor on multiple lines simultaneously
subtasks.name: Opt + [Left-Click]

subtasks.notes: Move line up/down (reordering). Holding it with `Shift` will copy/duplicate the line as well.
subtasks.name: Opt + ↑/↓

subtasks.notes: Column/Box Selection: Select blocks of text by holding it while you drag your mouse.
subtasks.name: Opt + Shift

subtasks.notes: Jump to a specific symbol (a function/class/variable/etc.) in the file
subtasks.name: Cmd + Shift + O

subtasks.notes: Switch to a specific editor/tab by number
subtasks.name: Ctrl + [1-9]

subtasks.notes: Shift focus from the terminal pane to the terminal tabs view
subtasks.name: Cmd + Shift + \

subtasks.notes: Show or hide highlights in a shared note
subtasks.name: Ctrl + Cmd + I

subtasks.notes: Show or hide the activity list in a shared note
subtasks.name: Ctrl + Cmd + K

subtasks.notes: Go to the previous day, week, month, or year
subtasks.name: Cmd + ←

subtasks.notes: Go to the next day, week, month, or year
subtasks.name: Cmd + →

subtasks.notes: Set reminder as due next weekend (Saturday)
subtasks.name: Cmd + K

subtasks.notes: Set reminder as due next week (Monday)
subtasks.name: Opt + Cmd + K

subtasks.notes: Mark reminder as completed or incomplete
subtasks.name: Shift + Cmd + C

subtasks.notes: Go to pinned list. To find the number assigned to each list, choose View > Go To.
subtasks.name: Cmd + [List-Number]

subtasks.notes:
While editing: Save/exit editing the reminder; While not editing: Mark reminder as complete
—
1. When editing a reminder (e.g., you’ve clicked into it to change the text), `Cmd` + `Enter` will end editing — it finalizes your changes and exits the editing mode (kind of feels like “selecting” or saving the text).
2. When not editing (e.g., you're just navigating or viewing reminders), `Cmd` + `Enter` will select all text and enter the editing mode.
subtasks.name: Cmd + Enter

subtasks.notes: Move back to the previous Finder location
subtasks.name: Cmd + [

subtasks.notes: Move forward to the next Finder location
subtasks.name: Cmd + ]

subtasks.notes: Show the active window in icon mode
subtasks.name: Cmd + 1

subtasks.notes: Show the active window in list mode
subtasks.name: Cmd + 2

subtasks.notes: Show the active window in column mode
subtasks.name: Cmd + 3

subtasks.notes: Show the active window in gallery mode
subtasks.name: Cmd + 4

subtasks.notes: Move the selected item to Trash
subtasks.name: Cmd + Delete/Backspace

subtasks.notes: Open (or launch) the selected item, just like double-clicking it
subtasks.name: Cmd + O

subtasks.notes: Open the Info window for the selected item
subtasks.name: Cmd + I

subtasks.notes: Reveal hidden files such as ._ (dot underscore) files that are normally invisible
subtasks.name: Cmd + Shift + .

subtasks.notes: Takes you to a folder that you specify
subtasks.name: Cmd + Shift + G

subtasks.notes: On any dock app opens it in Finder. This also works in Spotlight: If you hold `Cmd` while pressing `Enter`, it will show the app (or file) in Finder!
subtasks.name: Cmd + [Left-Click]

subtasks.notes: Lets you look up a dictionary definition for the word you hover over with the cursor (no need to select it)
subtasks.name: Cmd + Ctrl + D

subtasks.notes: Snip the full screen and copy the screenshot to clipboard
subtasks.name: Cmd + Ctrl + Shift + 3

subtasks.notes: Snip the selected area and copy the screenshot to clipboard
subtasks.name: Cmd + Ctrl + Shift + 4

subtasks.notes: Capture a portion of the screen (selected area)
subtasks.name: Cmd + Shift + 4

subtasks.notes: Open the Screenshot app (to e.g., record screen). This is where you can select/change the default folder/location where screenshots are saved.
subtasks.name: Cmd + Shift + 5

subtasks.notes: Use emojis/symbols. Press it alongside the text to get the corresponding emoji/symbols
subtasks.name: Ctrl + Cmd + Space

subtasks.notes: Open a Finder window with the search bar active
subtasks.name: Opt + Cmd + Space

subtasks.notes: Show the menu bar search, which reveals the menu bar with the added benefit of putting the cursor in the search field, so that you can quickly type the command you want and hit `Enter`
subtasks.name: Cmd + Shift + /

subtasks.notes: Jump to the start of the line
subtasks.name: Ctrl + A

subtasks.notes: Jump to the end of the line
subtasks.name: Ctrl + E

subtasks.notes: Delete everything you've written in Terminal and start over, in case you entered any typos in between
subtasks.name: Ctrl + U

subtasks.notes: Delete a word backwards from the current cursor position
subtasks.name: Ctrl + W

subtasks.notes: Paste text from the kill buffer
subtasks.name: Ctrl + Y

subtasks.notes: Delete a word forwards from the current cursor position
subtasks.name: Opt + D

subtasks.notes: Open link in a new tab
subtasks.name: Cmd + [Left-Click]

subtasks.notes: Save the current tab as a favorite (i.e., bookmark the current tab)
subtasks.name: Cmd + D

subtasks.notes: Show/Hide toolbar in full screen mode
subtasks.name: Cmd + Shift + F

subtasks.notes: Open a new InPrivate (無痕模式/私密瀏覽) window
subtasks.name: Cmd + Shift + N

subtasks.notes: Close the current window, along with all its tabs
subtasks.name: Cmd + Shift + W

subtasks.notes:
Moves to the next tab (rightward)
—
Note that `Ctrl` + `Tab` might follow **recently used order** depending on browser settings, while `Opt` + `Cmd` + `[Right-Arrow]` always moves tabs in **linear/sequential order**.
subtasks.name: Ctrl + Tab

subtasks.notes:
Moves to the previous tab (leftward)
—
Note that `Ctrl` + `Shift ` + `Tab` might follow **recently used order** depending on browser settings, while `Opt` + `Cmd` + `[Left-Arrow]` always moves tabs in **linear/sequential order**.
subtasks.name: Ctrl + Shift + Tab

subtasks.notes:
Moves to the next tab (rightward)
—
Note that `Opt` + `Cmd` + `[Right-Arrow]` always moves tabs in **linear/sequential order**, while `Ctrl` + `Tab` might follow **recently used order** depending on browser settings.
subtasks.name: Opt + Cmd + [Right-Arrow]

subtasks.notes:
Moves to the previous tab (leftward)
—
Note that `Opt` + `Cmd` + `[Left-Arrow]` always moves tabs in **linear/sequential order**, while `Ctrl` + `Shift` + `Tab` might follow **recently used order** depending on browser settings.
subtasks.name: Opt + Cmd + [Left-Arrow]
